Comment: I am having a hard time with the Guardian posts being removed for not using exact title, so instead of making a new post, here is the Guardian article on what he said:  [https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/may/01/rfk-mmr-vaccines-fetus-claim](https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/may/01/rfk-mmr-vaccines-fetus-claim)  "Although Kennedy has made false and misleading statements about vaccines generally, the Covid-19 vaccine appears to be especially in the administration‚Äôs crosshairs.  In response to recent¬†[questions about Covid-19 strategy](https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/apr/26/rfk-jr-chronic-disease-covid)¬†from the Guardian, the administration responded: ‚ÄúThe Covid-19 pandemic is over, and HHS will no longer waste billions of taxpayer dollars responding to a non-existent pandemic that Americans moved on from years ago.‚Äù  [How ‚Äòrevenge of the Covid contrarians‚Äô unleashed by RFK Jr puts broader vaccine advances at riskRead more](https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/apr/26/rfk-jr-chronic-disease-covid)  Health officials have reportedly required all research grant applications on messenger RNA technology, which powers most Covid-19 vaccines, be¬†[flagged to Kennedy‚Äôs office](https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/mar/27/trump-vaccine-skeptics-research-funding). They have also ended research that tested for the Covid-19 vaccine‚Äôs safety and efficacy in special groups, such as pregnant women, as part of an¬†[$11bn clawback](https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/apr/02/rfk-hhs-layoffs-lawsuit)¬†in grants from states.  Most controversially, the Food and Drug Administration has delayed expected approval of a new Covid-19 vaccine from Novavax, reportedly on the review of a political appointee known to be skeptical of vaccines."  That political appointee was a sports medicine doctor who was very much against mRNA vaccines when they came out.  Don't know what she thinks of Novavax, which is a more traditional vaccine.  And I agree that way too many Americans have moved on from Covid 19, but the pandemic is not over just bc we are over it.  It is still classified as such by the WHO and at least recently, the US government (dunno about today).  Many pandemics wax and wane for decades.  We don't really know what's going on bc after the Republicans voted down another spending bill a year and half ago, Covid kind of dropped off the radar.  Although Biden seemed happy to not talk about it either.  It is a respiratory, vascular, and inflammatory disease that is worse than the flipping flu.

Comment: The mainstream coverage of RFK Jr has been atrocious. This clearly reflects the fact that he is making many powerful industries very uncomfortable, especially Big Pharma, which dominates advertising slots on mainstream TV and is one of the most powerful lobbying groups in Washington - with 2-3 lobbyists for every congress person.  Let's take a look at the newsweek article: RFK Jr says that some people do not vaccinate because of the aborted fetus debris in the MMR vaccine.  The article attempts to rebut this with 2 strawmen arguments:  1) they say that "fetal cells are not in the vaccine itself." Yes, that's why RFK Jr said "aborted fetus debris" not cells  2) they say that "these original cells have been replicated over time, and current vaccine production uses descendant cells, not any tissue from the original fetuses." Yes, vaccine makers are not continuously harvesting cells from new fetuses to make the vaccine. Nobody ever claimed that. The cells originally came from a fetus in the 1960s and have been replicated since then to grow new viruses for the vaccines (viruses need cells to reproduce they do not reproduce by themselves outside of cells). If you take a fetal cell and reproduce it in a lab, it's still a fetal cell. I don't think a Mennonite who has ethical objections to harvesting cells from aborted fetuses will go "oh it's not an original cell from the fetus, just a copy, reproduced in a lab - ok sign me up for the vaccine then".  So what RFK, Jr is saying is absolutely correct. The media is doing a terrible job of reporting what he says, just like a few weeks ago they lied about his comments regarding the 25% of profound autistic children who are non-verbal, by making it seem like he was talking about all autistic children.  Finally, let's give some more context: as the article says the cell lines used to manufacture MMR are WI-38 and MRC-5.  **WI-38** is a Diploid human cell line composed of fibroblasts derived from lung tissue of a 3-month-gestation female fetus.  **MRC-5** is a Diploid cell line made up of fibroblasts isolated from the lung tissue derived from a White, male, 14-week-old embryo.  Can the debris from these cells be filtered out to only leave the virus? No they can't:  >As certain viruses are wanted in the vaccines, no particles of the same size or smaller can be filtered out.  >There thus remain in the common vaccines numerous other viruses, foreign proteins, residual segments of DNA and RNA, toxins, enzymes and possibly prions and oncogenes. It has proved impossible to remove these contaminants.   >This is well known to the regulatory authorities, greatly concerns many of their experts, but these very serious concerns are not communicated to the public.  [Janine Roberts "Fear of the Invisible"](https://www.amazon.com/Fear-Invisible-Janine-Roberts/dp/0955917727)  To its credit, unlike some of the other news articles, newsweek doesn't lie about the filtering process. But RFK, Jr accurately represented why some groups have ethical objections to the MMR.
